text.entityculling.title: EntityCulling
text.entityculling.tab.tick_culling.tool: Entities selected in this tab will not have their tick method optimized when culled. This can be useful for entities that need to tick for certain functionality, such as Boats.
text.entityculling.tab.entity_culling.to: Entities selected in this tab will not be culled at all. This is mainly needed for client-side entities or entities that need to be rendered regardless of their visibility.
text.entityculling.tab.block_entity_cull: Block entities selected in this tab will not be culled at all. This is mainly needed for block entities that need to be rendered regardless of their visibility.
text.entityculling.renderNametagsThrough: When turned off, culled entities will not have their nametags rendered through walls.
text.entityculling.tickCulling.tooltip: When turned on, entities that are culled will not tick. This can improve performance in some cases, but may cause issues with certain mods. Consider the finer control options in the other tab.
text.entityculling.disableF3.tooltip: When turned on, the F3 debug info will not show culling information.
text.entityculling.skipEntityCulling.too: When turned on, culling of entities will be skipped entirely. This can be useful for debugging or when you want to disable culling temporarily.
text.entityculling.skipBlockEntityCullin: When turned on, culling of block entities will be skipped entirely. This can be useful for debugging or when you want to disable culling temporarily.
text.entityculling.blockEntityFrustumCul: When turned on, block entity state extraction will be culled based on the camera's view frustum. This can improve performance in case your modloader/another mod doesn't do this already.
